column4: I'm having problums installing UBUNTU.  I've tried installing Breazy, Dapper, and the current version.
If I try to install the newest version, It says that it cannot open the TTY Device which apparently is a known bug.
If I try to install Dapper, it tells me that it cannot mount the CD.  Even though its already loaded and running.
If I try and install Breazy it installs to the point where it asks me to configure my user account and then all it does is ask me over and over agian and will not progress any further.
Can somebody help me get one of these versions installed?  I'd like to end up with Dapper if possible.
are you installing from text mode or live cd?
Text Mode
any odd hardware? how much ram? sometimes certain usb devices disagree with the installer (ive had troubles with a webcam)
Nothing overly unsual.  I had all this working before, but i've had to change motherboards
do you have any usb devices plugged in?
A printer (Dell A920), USB Mouse, A Nostromo Keypad, and a thrustmaster joystick
you might want to try unplugging everything that isnt needed and then plugging them back in once you have a successful install. Otherwise you might want to try fiesty.
I'm technical enough I can run a version of Linux if everything works right. Im not good enough that I can tinker with releases that arn't final yet ;-)
fiesty is far along enough that it will be stable. Also has some pretty cool new features.
Yes but its not well documented yet.  The reason I want to go with Dapper for the moment is because if I want to do anything with it I can find something pretty easy on google to explain it to me
Yes and it told me /bin/sh cant access tty; Job control turned off and then gave me a prompt I couln't do anything with
what motherboard are you using
Checking now,  I belive its an AZURS or MSI board with a NVidia Nforce2 chipset
are you using the integrated video?
IT has onboard but I have an AGP card installed.
did you try fiesty?
I understand that you may be uncomfortable with using testing software but the truth is that the major differences between the different versions is simply versions of software
i agree
